title: US candidate to be first woman to lead UN telecoms agency
summary: Doreen Bogdan-Martin will become the first woman to head the U.N.’s telecoms agency in its 157-year history from January, and the first American in the role since the 1960s after beating a Russian leadership challenge.

title: Space surveillance telescope developed by the U.S. begins operations in Australia
summary: The Space Surveillance Telescope, declared operational Sept. 30, will join the network of sensors used by the United States, Australia and other allies to track objects in orbit

title: National Space Council to seek industry input on future regulatory framework
summary: The National Space Council plans to hold “learning sessions” with industry in coming weeks on how to develop a new regulatory framework for novel commercial space activities.

title: NASA, USGS Map Minerals to Understand Earth Makeup, Climate Change
summary: NASA and the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) will map portions of the southwest United States for critical minerals using advanced airborne imaging.

title: Space Force studying requirements for cislunar space domain awareness
summary: The Space Force expects to know by next spring what capabilities it will need to carry out space domain awareness activities in cislunar space.
